div.p: SETTINGDATETYPE is an optional attribute, attached to the element TSETTINGDATE (in WRITING TEXTUALFEATURES ), that specifies the historical era of a setting. It has four allowable values: past, present, future, and ambiguous.

div.codeblock: <TSETTINGDATE SETTINGDATETYPE="present">Elizabeth Fenwick sets her novel firmly in her own time.</TSETTINGDATE>

div.p: These values are determined in relation to the date at which the text was written. For example, 1984 is a futuristic novel because George Orwell wrote it in 1948.
